TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit Triplet extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides a basic utility class that is used to store three related objects.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Triplet class is used as a basic structure to store three related objects. It is a utility class that is used in various ways throughout ASP.NET. You can use the Triplet class in your own code anywhere that you need a structure to contain three related objects and where data-hiding is not essential. The Triplet class does not encapsulate its `object` references, <xref:System.Web.UI.Triplet.First>, <xref:System.Web.UI.Triplet.Second>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.Triplet.Third>, in properties; it exposes them directly to all calling code as public class fields.
## Examples The following example uses a Triplet object to hold three integer values and another Triplet to hold three label controls.
> [!NOTE] > When accessing reference types as members of a Triplet, only generic <xref:System.Object> methods are available for that member.
[!code-cs[System.Web.UI.Triplet#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.triplet_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Triplet#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.triplet_1.aspx)]
